description: De Miles Lake: Moisie River entrance pointLac de Miles, Minoustouc Lake, Opacoppa lake and Moisie river, an ancestral water route  linking the Labrador Atlantic  hydrographic basin to the  St-Laurewnce river north shore (arrival point at Sept-Iles).   A 400 km canoe trail with over 500 m elevation drop.I am travelling  a lot by plane between Wabush and Montreal via Sept Iles.  I always take a window seat. I am fascinated to look at these waterways and lakes that populate the area and other North features:. So many of them : Esker, the Mon-Groulx,  the Manic 5 reservoir, the Petite Manicouagan reservoir, the Moisie river canyon , the junction with the Carheil river.  Doing the ride on de Lac De Miles was not with the intention to go down to Sept-iles; I am still working and have not enough time to do that; and the sea kayaks are not the right equipment neither.  But to follow a trail that was used for thousands of years by the natives was giving a sense to the effort. A 23 km ride, easy, with a 2.2 km walk to change hydrographic basin, over Quebec-Labrador border.
directions: The access to the  lake is at KM 51 on road 500 from Labrador City going to Goose Bay.
title: De Mile Lake
